author: Redazione web
title: Madonna di Trevignano, Gisella Cardia si difende: «Io perseguitata come Santa Bernadette di Lourdes, la storia
text:
«Anche nel caso della Santa di Lourdes sia la Chiesa che le autorità civili osteggiarono in tutti i modi il fenomeno delle apparizioni e qui la storia si ripete». Gisella Cardia non eprde tempo e su Youtube inzia la linea di difesa dopo che le indagini nei laboratori di Tor Vergata (Roma) hanno confermato che il sangue sulla Madonna di Trevignano appartiene alla "santona". I risultati, ancora sotto segreto istrutturio, verranno acquisiti dalla procura che indaga per truffa.
Madonna di Trevignano, il sangue sulla statua è della veggente Gisella Cardia. Lei si difende: «L'ho maneggiata e baciata» Chi è la santona
La difesa su Youtube
La Madonna che piange sangue di Trevignano non ha nulla di soprannaturale, ha certifcato il vescovo Marco Salvi il 6 marzo del 2024. Ma Cardia, vero nome Maria Giuseppa Scarpulla, vuole a tutti i costi creare un parallelo con Lourdes, località sui Pirenei, e le apparizioni della Madonna alla contadina analfabeta Bernadette, proclamata santa da apa Pio XI l'8 dicembre 1933. «A 167 anni da Lourdes - dice la voce narrante nel video sul canale Youtube di Cardia, sulle note del Magnificnat intonato da Mina - la Chiesa e le autorità civili hanno adottato una serie di provvedimenti dalle sbalorditive somiglianze nei confronti delle apparizioni, ancora in corso, della Santa Vergine a Gisella Cardia, avvenute per la prima volta nel 2016 a Trevignano Romano»
«È una ragazza piena di difetti, se la Madonna le è apparsa non è per i suoi meriti, dicevano di Bernadette.
«Gisella come Bernadette, abbracciata da alcuni e insultata da altri»
«Bernadette è stata insultata e non peteva uscire di casa, così come Gisella, che a causa degli insulti e delle persecuzioni della gente amplificate dalla stampa si è barricata in casa. Come Bernadette anche Gisella viene abbracciata e accolta da alcuni, insultata e perseguitata da altri che la accusano di dire menzogne. E il divieto di lasciare oggetti di culto e e di recarsi sul luogo dell'apparizione imposti sia a Bernadette, che le è stato vietato di recarsi alla grotta così per Gisella, alla quale è stato confiscato il campo delle preghiere. Entrambe scortate, considerate ingiustamente dalla reputazione sospetta, messa in dubbio al loro sanità mentale e visitate dai medici»
Ultimo aggiornamento: Domenica 16 Febbraio 2025, 18:32
© RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA

author: Zonebourse
title: Un port clé d'Haïti fermé à l'accès terrestre après des attaques de gangs - Zonebourse
text:
La société haïtienne Caribbean Port Services (CPS) a annoncé jeudi qu'elle fermait l'accès terrestre à son port de la capitale Port-au-Prince, un corridor clé pour les approvisionnements dans le pays et qui a été paralysé par des attaques de gangs armés. "La CPS fermera ses barrières à tout type de trafic terrestre du 26 au 29 septembre", a indiqué la CPS dans un communiqué, précisant que cela devrait permettre à l'armée et à la police nationale de poursuivre leurs efforts pour sécuriser la zone.
Un responsable des transports maritimes a déclaré cette semaine à Reuters que des tirs étaient dirigés contre les navires, les empêchant d'accoster et de décharger les conteneurs, tandis que les autorités ont signalé l'enlèvement de deux membres d'équipage philippins d'un navire de charge dans le port.
Les dirigeants haïtiens qui se sont exprimés cette semaine devant l'Assemblée générale des Nations unies ont mis en garde contre l'aggravation de l'insécurité malgré le déploiement partiel d'une force de sécurité soutenue par l'ONU, dont le mandat initial expire dans moins d'une semaine.
De puissants gangs, armés d'armes provenant en grande partie des États-Unis, se sont unis dans la capitale au sein d'une alliance commune et contrôlent désormais la majeure partie de la ville et s'étendent aux zones avoisinantes.
Plus de 700 000 personnes ont été déplacées à l'intérieur du pays, soit près du double du chiffre d'il y a six mois. Beaucoup d'entre elles résident dans des camps de fortune, dans des écoles, et n'ont pas de source de revenus fixe alors que la nourriture devient de plus en plus chère et que les taux de famine montent en flèche.
Les principaux ports maritimes et l'aéroport international d'Haïti ont été fermés pendant près de trois mois au début de l'année, alors que la violence atteignait son paroxysme à la fin du mois de février, lors d'une flambée qui a vu des milliers de personnes sortir de prison et le dernier premier ministre démissionner.
Partager Accéder à l'article original .
Avertissement légal Avertissement légal
Contactez-nous pour toute demande de correction
Retour © Reuters - 2024

author: Gregg Montgomery
title: Indianapolis police honor fallen officer Breann Leath during roll call - Indianapolis News | Indiana Weather | Indiana Traffic | WISH-TV |
text:
Indianapolis police honor fallen officer Breann Leath during roll call
INDIANAPOLIS (WISH) — Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Department on Wednesday honored the memory of fallen officer Breann Leath.
Leath died in the line of duty five years ago.
Officers on Wednesday paid their respects during the department’s East District roll call at the Indianapolis Metropolitan Law Enforcement Training Academy. Leath’s mother thanked IMPD for its dedication to keeping her daughter’s memory alive.
Jennifer Leath told the officers, “Her family, her son were not the only ones grieving. You, her IMPD family, felt that loss deeply as well, and, even though five years have passed, I know the grief is still very real and raw for you as well. So, today we gather to honor the bright light she was.”
Leath died after being shot while responding to a domestic violence call. Elliahs Dorsey a year ago was sentenced to more than 30 years in prison for her murder.
A prayer vigil was scheduled for Wednesday evening at the IMPD chaplain’s office.
News at your fingertips!Stay informed with
Indiana,
Local, and
National Newsstraight to your inbox.

author: Renan Porto
title: Após crescer em pesquisa, Marçal provoca Bolsonaro: “Somos só nós”
text:
Após crescer em pesquisa, Marçal provoca Bolsonaro: “Somos só nós”
Mais cedo, em troca de farpas no Instagram, Bolsonaro havia questionado participação de Marçal em sua gestão: “Nós?”, ironizou ex-presidente
atualizado
Compartilhar notícia
São Paulo — Após crescer sete pontos percentuais na
pesquisa Datafolha divulgada nesta quinta-feira (22/8), o candidato do PRTB à Prefeitura de São Paulo, Pablo Marçal, fez uma provocação ao ex-presidente Jair Bolsonaro (PL) em uma mensagem divulgada por meio de sua assessoria.
Mais cedo, Marçal e Bolsonaro trocaram farpas em uma postagem do ex-presidente no Instagram. Horas depois, Bolsonaro concedeu uma entrevista ao colunista Paulo Cappelli, do Metrópoles, na qual disse que Marçal “não tem caráter”.
“Somos só NÓS (o povo e Deus) contra tudo e todos. A piada virou pesadelo e não vai ter segundo turno”, escreveu Marçal após a divulgação da pesquisa Datafolha.
No levantamento, Marçal subiu de 14% para 21% das invenções de voto, superando o candidato de Bolsonaro, o atual prefeito
Ricardo Nunes (MDB), que caiu de 23% para 19%. O candidato do PSol, Guilherme Boulos, lidera com 23%.
Troca de farpas nas redes
Durante a manhã, Marçal havia recebido uma resposta irônica de Bolsonaro ao comentar uma postagem em que o ex-presidente celebrava investimentos no setor rodoviário feitos em seu governo. O candidato do PRTB escreveu: “Eles vão ter saudade de nós”. Bolsonaro ironizou o pronome usado, questionando a participação do influenciador: “Nós? Um abraço”.
Marçal retrucou dizendo que contribuiu com doações para a campanha de Bolsonaro. “Só não nos curvaremos a comunistas na eleição de São Paulo, e se o capitão quiser me tirar do ‘nós’, me ajude devolvendo os 100 mil reais depositando na minha campanha aqui de prefeito de São Paulo”.
A troca de farpas nas redes sociais ocorreu enquanto o candidato do PRTB é alvo de críticas de bolsonaristas nas redes sociais. O deputado federal Eduardo Bolsonaro (PL), filho do ex-presidente, também divulgou um vídeo nessa quarta (21/8) criticando o influencer.
“Falta caráter”
Jair Bolsonaro disse ao Metrópoles que Pablo Marçal não tem caráter e que o candidato do PRTB mentiu após uma reunião entre eles. O ex-presidente ainda reafirmou seu apoio a Ricardo Nunes.
“Falta caráter ao Marçal. Ele me esculhambava até perto da eleição de 2022. Dizia que a diferença entre Lula e eu se resumia a um dedo e me chamou de ‘quadrilheiro’. Poucas semanas depois, quando não pôde ser candidato à Presidência, mudou de lado na reta final da campanha. Isso é falta de caráter”, disse.
“Recentemente eu recebi o Pablo Marçal. Tivemos uma conversa reservada e cordial, entreguei uma medalha [imorrível, imbrochável, incomível] a ele. Duas horas depois dessa reunião, ele espalhou que eu não apoiaria o Ricardo Nunes (MDB). Eu reafirmo que apoio o Nunes e não tenho nenhum compromisso com o Marçal”, complementou o ex-presidente.
Questionado se devolveria a doação de R$ 100 mil que Marçal diz ter feito, Bolsonaro respondeu:
“Ele deu Pix para quem? A Polícia Federal revirou a lista de doadores e não tem nenhum Pix dele na minha conta, naquela arrecadação feita em 2023. Se ele doou para o partido [na campanha de 2022], o problema é dele. Ao menos ele doou para um candidato honesto”.

author: Maia Had
title: Alerta por una fuerte tormenta en Corrientes: “Hay familias que perdieron todo”
text:
Una fuerte tormenta azotó a la provincia de Corrientes generando estragos en todas partes. La ciudad de Bella Vista fue la principal zona damnificada ya que se encuentra sin servicio desde lo ocurrido, además provocó la caída de árboles, voladuras de techos y casas destruidas.
Clima en Argentina: en qué provincias hay alerta amarilla para la noche de Año Nuevo En la capital , las lluvias se desataron a las 4 de la mañana , con unos vientos a 40 kilómetros por hora. Esto causó cortes de luz, árboles derribados y destrucción de viviendas . Según informó Diario El Libertador , el nivel del agua llegó a los 37 milímetros.
Destrozos en Bella Vista La intendenta de Bella Vista , Noelia Bazzi , dialogó con Radio Dos y comentó cómo se encuentra la ciudad tras el fuerte temporal: “Es una situación muy difícil la que estamos atravesando. Desde la madrugada, a las 2.30, 3 de la madrugada que se empezaron a desatar fuertes vientos . Algo nunca visto, tenemos la ciudad destruida, esa es la realidad”, afirmó.
Afirmó que la tormenta llegó a la zona céntrica, zona periférica y zona rural : “Estamos trabajando desde muy temprano con el equipo de área social y asistencia a las familias que están complicadas y damnificas. En algunos casos llevándolos al albergue polideportivo, en otros casos, asistiéndolos directamente en el lugar. Los equipos de infraestructura y de producción están i ntentando empezar a reorganizar y reordenar la ciudad. Tenemos muchísimos árboles caídos, plazas completamente destruidas”, afirmó.
Y continuó diciendo: “ Todo es preocupante . Tenemos la ciudad completamente sin servicio, así que se está trabajando en todo lo que tiene que ver con restablecer el servicio: cables caídos, postes caídos. El área de infraestructuras está cortando un poco los árboles para poder, por lo menos, normalizar un poco las calles, porque hay lugares a los cuales ni pudimos llegar porque los caminos no nos lo permiten”.
La ciudad completa se quedó sin servicio. Foto: Data Chaco Con respecto a los vecinos de la ciudad, Bazzi aseguró: “ Hay familias que perdieron todo, casas por completo . En algunos casos, voladuras de techos, en otros, cayeron las casas por completo. Todo muy triste, catastrófico en toda la ciudad”. Y añadió: “Tenemos cuarteles de bomberos completamente destruidos, unidades destruidas por la caída de muros, canchas destruidas, productores que perdieron todo”.
La intendenta comentó que la principal preocupación es “ asistir a las familias. Todo el equipo municipal está trabajando, mucha gente de la ciudad que se sumó a colaborar con su motosierra , con sus camiones, y el gobierno de la provincia que está monitoreando todo la situación. Estamos desbordados con respecto a los recursos humanos , y ni hablar de la pérdida millonaria que vamos a tener en la ciudad por todos los daños ocasionados”.
Temporal en Corrientes: más de 600 evacuados y alertan una nueva crecida del nivel del agua También comentó que está recibiendo ayuda de la Provincia: “El ministro Buenaventura Duarte ya está llegando a la ciudad con defensa civil de la provincia. Ya estuve en contacto con el gobernador y con su equipo poniéndolos al tanto”. Y finalizó diciendo: “Estamos poniendo lo mejor de nosotros, pero la verdad que nada es suficiente por lo que estamos atravesando”.

author: Greg Gliddon
title: BFNL star Jaycob Hickey sidelined after leg fracture at training
text:
A BFNL premiership star is set to be sidelined for at least the rest of the home and away season after a training mishap this week.
Melton's Jaycob Hickey looks to have broken his leg after a training incident on Tuesday night.
At best, the injury is expected to keep Hickey sidelined until the finals, but if scans reveal a worse-than-expected injury, it could mean the star onballer misses the rest of the BFNL season.
Hickey was in dynamic form, particularly early this season, when he was named among the best players in seven of the first eight matches of the season. Those big games saw him score 22 votes in The Courier's BFNL player of the year to be just five votes behind leader Brett Bewley.
The injury to the Bloods' midfield maestro comes just one week after another finals contender, Sunbury, lost its best midfielder in Josh Guthrie for the remainder of the season.
Bloods coach Troy Scoble said it was simply an unlucky incident where a player fell across Hickey's leg at training.
"What we know at the moment is he has some form of fracture in his leg," Scoble said. "We don't know the severity of it as yet.
"He's had some scans on it yesterday and we're just waiting to see if there's any other damage associated with it.
"Initially, when it happened, we thought it was an ankle, but it's definitely a fracture between his shin and his ankle. There's some form of fracture; it's dependent on the MRI scans now.
"If it's just a fracture, that's the best case scenario and we can just let that heal, but if there's more damage, then we'll have to work out what happens from there."
There are seven home-and-away matches still to play in the season, plus this weekend's bye week, giving Hickey an eight-week turnaround to be fit for the finals.
A top-three position for the club, which currently sits second on the ladder, should ensure a double chance, provided the third-placed team does not go down to the sixth-placed finisher in an elimination final.
It's been a wretched run with injury for the reigning BFNL premiers, who at the weekend had 21 players across their senior list sidelined, with the senior team just falling to top team Darley in a thrilling finish on Saturday.
"We've been quite unlucky that a lot of the injuries we've had have been broken bones and things like that, we haven't had the hamstrings and the calves and that type of thing," Scoble said.

author: Guest
title: Area Religious Services, Dec. 29 | Religion | thewesterlysun.com - The Westerly Sun
text:
Central Baptist Church
WESTERLY — Worship service will be held on Sunday at 10:30 a.m. in the Sanctuary. Rev. Dr. Cal Lord's sermon will be "Get Ready to Move!” The scripture will be from Joshua 1:1-11.
The service will be livestreamed at 10:30 a.m. on Facebook at Central-Baptist-Church-of-Westerly-RI for those unable to attend in person. The service will also be available on YouTube under Cal Lord after 1 p.m. on Sunday. To pray with someone, call Pastor Cal at 401-596-4929.
Adult Bible Study is offered at 9 a.m. Children’s Sunday School for grades K-6 will be held concurrently with the worship service at 10:30 am. Nursery care for toddlers and preschool will be offered.
A worship service will be held on Wednesday at 7 p.m.
The church is located at 16 Elm St. For more information and other upcoming events, visit
cbcwesterlyri.org or call the church office at 401-596-4929.
Christ Church
WESTERLY — In-person services will be held on Saturday, at 5 p.m., Rite I; Sunday at 8 a.m., Holy Eucharist, Rite I; and at 10 a.m., Choral Eucharist, Rite II.
Nursery care will be available beginning at 9:30 a.m. to 11:30 a.m., for the 10 a.m. service. Sunday School will resume Jan. 7.
The Holy Eucharist is also celebrated on Wednesday at 10 a.m., with Bible study following at 10:30 a.m.
On Sunday, Dec. 31, the annual Festival of Lessons and Carols for Christmas will be held at 5 p.m. The service will feature choral music by the choir of Christ Church, congregational singing of carols and hymns, and the reading of the lessons in celebration of the birth of the Christ child. The lessons, read by parish members and lay leaders from the community, recount the ancient prophecies and the joy of Christ coming into the world. Doors open at 4:30 p.m., and a reception in the Parish Hall follows the service.
Services offered online will be Holy Eucharist, Rite I, Saturday at 5 p.m.; and Choral Eucharist, Rite II, on Sunday at 10 a.m., on Christ Church Westerly’s Facebook and at
christchurchwesterly.org.
The church is located at 7 Elm St. For more information, email or visit
christchurchwesterly.org or call 401-596-0197.
Congregational Church, United, UCC
PAWCATUCK — Worship with will be held on Sunday at 9:45 a.m., in person and virtually at
uccwesterly.org or at facebook.com/UCCWesterly. The service will bless the New Year with Rev. Ruth’s sermon “In Pursuit of Destiny.”
All worship services are offered in person or online at
facebook.com/UCCWesterly.
The church is officially an Open and Affirming congregation of the United Church of Christ. The church is located at 9 Castle Hill Road off Pequot Trail. The office is open Monday, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m., and Thursday, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Visit
http://uccwesterly.org or facebook.com/UCCWesterly or call 860-599-1226 for more information.
Babcock Presbyterian Church
ASHAWAY — Worship will be held at 9:30 a.m. in the church sanctuary. Nursery service will be available downstairs in fellowship hall. Coffee Hour will follow worship in fellowship hall.
The Blessing Box is open outside the church building 24/7 as a Community Service to anyone in need. People may “take what you need” and anyone who is able may “give what they can.” Please donate only non-perishable, commercially canned, or packaged goods and personal hygiene items. Food can be put directly onto the shelves to help meet the current increased need.
The church is located at 25 Maxson St. For more information, visit
babcockpresbyterianchurch.com.
Congregational Church of North Stonington
NORTH STONINGTON — The Congregational Church of North Stonington will offer in-person worship on Sunday at 10 a.m. in the Sanctuary. Pastor Sue Latourette will lead the service. Scripture lesson will be Galatians 4:4-7 and Luke 2:22-40. The child Jesus visits the Temple.
Sunday Church School will be held via Zoom. A live-stream of the service will be available at
congregationalchurchofnorthstonington.org. The bulletin is available online.
The church is located at 89 Main St. The pastor is Rev. Susan G. Latourette. For more information, visit
congregationalchurchofnorthstonington.org or call 860-535-0379, Monday to Thursday, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m.
Unitarian Universalist Congregation of South County
PEACE DALE — Sunday service will be held at 10 a.m. in person and online at
uusouthcountyri.org. Rev. Denis Paul and Amber Kelly Collins will lead the service with the sermon "The Layers of the Onion."
Masks are optional in the sanctuary.
The church is located at the Lily Pads Professional Complex at 27 North Road. Call 401-783-4170 or visit
uusouthcountyri.org for more information.
Calvary Episcopal Church
STONINGTON – Calvary Episcopal Church will hold in-person services on Sunday for Holy Eucharist at 8 a.m., Holy Eucharist Rite I, and at 10 a.m., Holy Eucharist, Rite II.
The services will be streamed live at
calvarychurchstonington.org on the worship services page. A digital Sunday bulletin can be viewed to follow the worship.
Attendees should check with ushers regarding nursery care.
The Church by the Sea, located at 27 Church St., is involved in local mission, including through the Pawcatuck Neighborhood Center and local soup kitchens. Adult education and enrichment programs are offered, along with the Calvary Nursery School and Calvary Music School. For more information, visit
calavarychurchstonington.org or call 860-535-1181.
Second Baptist Church of North Stonington
NORTH STONINGTON — Second Baptist Church of North Stonington, 12 Stillman Road, is an independent, conservative, evangelical Baptist church. It is a Bible-based church with practical preaching and teaching for all ages.
Sunday service will be held at 10 a.m. The service will be streamed at
sites.google.com/view/second-baptist-church.
On Wednesday, activities include the Fellowship Café at 5:30 p.m.; Olympian program for children grades K to six at 5:30 p.m.; and Adult and Youth Studies at 6 p.m.
For more information, call the church office at 860-599-2077 or email .
St. Thomas Episcopal Church
ALTON — Weekly worship services are held in person on Sunday at 9 a.m. All are welcome. The service will be live streamed on YouTube and on Facebook at
facebook.com/StThomasEpiscopalChurchAltonRI.
The church has a wood-frame clothing drop-off shed for community members to donate clean, well-cared-for used clothing. The church will receive funding for the donated clothing and will use donations to serve community needs. Accepted items include clothing, shoes, belts, purses, blankets, sheets, curtains, pillowcases, and stuffed animals.
The church is located at 322 Church St. in Wood River Junction. For more information, visit
stthomasalton.blogspot.com.
St. Andrew Lutheran Church
CHARLESTOWN — St. Andrew Lutheran Church worship service will be held at 8:30 a.m. and 10:30 a.m. each Sunday. The 10:30 a.m. service will be streamed at
facebook.com/standrewlutheranchurch. Each service is unique; featuring a variety of music and weekly Communion.
Children's Church for little ones includes music, crafts and a story each week during the second half of the 10:30 a.m. service.
Coffee Hour will be held after the service with coffee, goodies, and community.
St. Andrew Lutheran Church is located at 15 East Beach Road. The church welcomes all to participate in contemporary, progressive worship services with a community whose focus is putting faith into action. For more information, call the church office at 401-322-0088 or visit
standrewri.org.
Hope Church: South County
SOUTH KINGSTOWN — Hope Church: South County is a non-denominational church offering worship on Sundays at 9 a.m. at South Kingstown Recreation Center, 30 St. Dominic Road. Masks are not required. Online church is streamed live at 9 a.m. at hoperi.church.
For more information, visit hoperi.church; email ; or call 401-944-6604.
The Pilgrim’s Baptist Church
ASHAWAY — Worship service will be held at 10 a.m. on Sunday. Coffee and bottled water will be available prior to the service at 9:45 a.m.
Nursery care and a children’s program for grades K to 6 will be available during the service.
For more information, call the church office at 401-377-6077 or email via Facebook at
facebook.com/PilgrimsBaptistChurchAshaway. The Pilgrim's Baptist Church is located at 27 Chase Hill Road, Ashaway.
First Baptist Church of North Stonington
NORTH STONINGTON — Sunday service will be held at 10 a.m.
The church is located at 793 Pendleton Hill Road. For more information, call 860-599-5331.
Dunn’s Corners Community Church
WESTERLY — In-person worship services will be held on Sunday at 8 and 10 a.m. There will be a live stream of the 10 a.m. service at
dunnscornerschurch.org.
Bible Study is held on Tuesdays at 9:30 a.m. Teen Time meets on Tuesdays from 5 to 7:30 p.m. for teens in grade 7 to 12.
Call 401-322-0655 or email the church office for more information. The church is located at 221 Post Road.
The Church at Westerly
WESTERLY — The Church at Westerly Services begin at 10 a.m. on Sundays at 120 Main St., beginning with a time of fellowship over coffee at 9:45 a.m. Sunday School for children up to age 12 will be held during the message. Contact Pastor Fred at 401-533-7206 with any needs or questions.
Joy Fellowship Assembly of God
BRADFORD — Joy Fellowship Assembly of God, 17 Bowling Lane, is a Christ centered Church which preaches the Word of God and offers contemporary live worship.
The church meets every Sunday for worship with service at 10 a.m. Fellowship hour will be held at 9:15 a.m. Children's Church is offered for ages 4 to 13.
The service will be live streamed at
joyfellowshipri.org for those unable to attend.
A Celebrate Recovery service is held every Thursday at 6:30 p.m.
The church hosts the Pantry on the Lane food pantry every Saturday from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. at 70 Bowling Lane. Food boxes containing meats, dairy, fruits, vegetables, cheese, yogurts and dry goods are available outside the church building. To receive a box of food, drive-in, open your trunk and drive away.
For more information, contact the church at 401-465-7745 or or visit
joyfellowshipri.org.
The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
WESTERLY — Sacrament Service for all is held on Sundays at 10 a.m. led by pastor Will Mason.
Sunday School classes are available for ages 18 months to 11 years, youth, and adults on Sundays at 11:15 a.m. There are youth, family, and adult activities, and women's ministry.
The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is located at 114-116 Granite St. Entrance is inside the Atrium across from Keifer's Martial Arts. Phone number is 860-572-4942, website
ChurchofJesusChrist.org. Handicap accessible and all are welcome.
Pleasant Street Baptist Church
WESTERLY — Church service will be held at 10:45 a.m. and streamed on the church’s Facebook page,
facebook.com/PSBCNorthEndWesterly. Bible-Based Church School will be held for all ages on Sunday at 9:30 a.m.
Wednesday evening Bible Study will be held at 7 p.m.
Pleasant Street Baptist Church is at 37 Pleasant St., Minister Mallory Davis, pastor. For more information, call 401-596-1923 or email or visit the church Facebook page at
facebook.com/pg/PSBCNorthEndWesterly.
Trinity Lutheran Church and Preschool
ASHAWAY — Services are held at 9 a.m. on Sunday with Pastor Christopher Chandler.
Trinity Lutheran Church and Preschool is located at 110 High St. For more information, call 401-377-4340; or visit
trinityashaway.org, or Trinity’s Facebook page. For preschool information, call director Kelly Mills at 401-377-4216, or email .
Faith Bible Chapel
WESTERLY — Service will be held on Sunday at 10:30 a.m., at the church. For those unable to attend, the service will be livestreamed at
facebook.com/FBCWesterlyRI/live.
Faith Bible Chapel is a nondenominational Christian church located at 115 Ashaway Road. For more information, call the church at 401-348-9637, visit
faithbiblechapel.com.

author: @ABC21WPTA
title: L3Harris announces new high-tech facility in Fort Wayne to support U.S. defense
text:
L3Harris announces new high-tech facility in Fort Wayne to support U.S. defense
FORT WAYNE, Ind. (WPTA) - L3Harris has opened its new payload manufacturing and integration facility, marking a significant step forward in the space-based missile defense and weather technology.
Leaders say the facility is set to produce advanced payloads for U.S. defense systems.
Rob Mitrevski, Vice President of Spectral Solutions at L3Harris, says planning for this facility began years ago, with the idea that the Department of Defense needed a better way to protect the United States from emerging threats.
According to L3Harris leaders, northeast Indiana has a rich history in high-tech manufacturing, and that was a major factor in choosing the location.
Rep. Marlin Stutzman (R), who represents Indiana’s 3rd district, attended the ribbon-cutting ceremony and expressed his excitement for not only the technology but also for protecting the United States.
Stutzman says the benefits this will have for the area are endless, with more than 600 potential new jobs.

author: EIN News
title: Jeju, South Korea Retreat: Camaraderie Forged, Friendly Flourished - Insurance Industry Today - EIN Presswire
text:
Jeju, South Korea Retreat: Camaraderie Forged, Friendly Flourished / EIN News / -- Seoul, South Korea , Jan. 05, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- From 7 - 12 December 2023, esteemed partners of Procap International from South Korea, China and the Philippines had a very fruitful retreat on the picturesque island of Jeju, South Korea. During the retreat, partners from these 3 countries were able to share ideas, initiatives and strategies openly, frankly and sincerely in the conducive and scenic environment of this renowned island resort. At the end of the retreat, new camaraderie was forged, existing friendly flourished and new partnerships were established. Partners from the Philippines and China have extended their warm invitation.
During the retreat, partners had ample opportunities to interact with the management team as they discussed strategic plans and goals for Procap International going forward. The management team also elaborated on the business plans for the respective countries as the company is looking to expand its international reach and network.
At the end of the retreat, new camaraderie was forged, existing friendly flourished and new partnerships were established. Partners from the Philippines and China have extended their warm invitation for the South Korean partners to visit their respective countries in the coming months.
About Procap International
ProCap International, a technology-empowered, innovative financial services provider, is the pioneer of Capital Protection. The company is built based on risk management in prediction games; and selected trading instruments on exchanges.
By following the ProCap Formula, clients can get to enjoy stable returns daily by making the correct predictions; without the need to worry about making the wrong predictions and incurring any financial losses.
As the industry transits through consolidation and technological disruptions, ProCap’s avant-garde operating model is poised to provide the most competitive and cost-effective insurance products tailored to our clients’ ever-evolving needs. The amalgamation of ProCap, Policyholders and Gaming Operators seamlessly is an industry first with the company having tremendous growth potential to carve out a niche for itself with this revolutionary business model.

author: S Sundar
title: Vijayakant | Fans near Rajapalayam tonsure their heads to pay homage to late DMDK leader - The Hindu
text:
Four fans of late DMDK founder Vijayakant in Rajapalayam, paid their respects by tonsuring their heads on Friday, December 29, 2023. Following the tonsuring, the four paid homage to the late leader’s portrait.
“Captain Vijayakant is our sibling and we are performing the rituals for him, as we do for our family members,” said K. Arjunan (33), one of the fans, adding that they considered Vijayakant to be a family member.
Three others: Ramesh, Perumal and Kandasamy also had their heads tonsured. Arjunan got all of them all new shirts and dhotis, while the women of their families sang oppari (mourning song) to express their grief over the death of the actor-politician.
Wearing the new dhotis, the men paid homage to a portrait of Vijayakant with coconuts and bananas.
“We are not very well educated. However, our parents have told us since our childhoods about all the good deeds of the Captain,” said Arjunan, who said all four men work as loadmen and are members of the DMDK Loadmen Association.
Arjunan also said that DMDK cadre and fans of Vijayakanth would continue with the good work that has been their leader’s legacy. “The annadanam carried out by our leader will be continued by us,” he said.
